ygData.subject: Re: Help finding Brown chitten protector
ygData.msgSnippet: The terrorantula doesnt drop anything, we killed it several times and it never dropped an item. It could be that it does drop something now but one thing it
ygData.messageBody:
The terrorantula doesnt drop anything, we killed it several times and it
never dropped an item. It could be that it does drop something now but one
thing it does not drop is the chittin protector. That is found in Solusek
B.

----- Original Message -----
From: Enigma <enigma@...>
To: <EQCheats@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, July 09, 1999 3:07 PM
Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Help finding Brown chitten protector


>From: "Enigma" <enigma@...>
>
>I can tell you that's the truth, it is still a rip and yes it can eat sand
>giants. While hunting SG's we came across it 2 times it's poison is very
>damaging. But since it is a rare spawn, and a rare items not sure if it
>carries it.
>
>
><-- Enigma -->
>Follower of the Crimson Knights
>http://members.door.net/enigma
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
>From: Fling, Kirby [mailto:FlingKirby@...]
>Sent: Friday, July 09, 1999 1:17 PM
>To: 'EQCheats@onelist.com'
>Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Help finding Brown chitten protector
>
>From: "Fling, Kirby" <FlingKirby@...>
>
>By the time you are in the high teens, there is nothing in south ro worth
>your while (all green) with the exception of the occasional Sand Giant, the
>very rare Terrorantula, or the merchants.
>I've heard that the Terrorantula can eat a Sand Giant for breakfast, but
>then I personally saw a single group of high-30's (I'd guess) take it
>without too much difficulty. I have screen shots even. Anyway, they
looted
>it and started shouting complaints because it's a lvl 35 mob, and all it
had
>on it was a couple of spider silk, spider legs and like 5 gp or something?
>It was quite a rip. Of course, I saw this at least 2 or 3 patches ago, so
>the whole world of norrath could be completely freakin different now.
>* Kzak
>
>-----Original Message-----
>The Terrorantula does spawn in S Ro. All I have to say is good luck. He's
>big enough to sit on 2 sand dunes by himself. And if he doesn't get you,
the
>hordes of undead, madmen and orcs that usually mob you at this point might.
>BUT......... If you're high enough level or in a high level group, you
could
>probably take them.
>
